channel.title: Books on Asish Soudhamma
channel.description: Recent content in Books on Asish Soudhamma

item.title: The Courage to Be Disliked
item.description: How to unlock the power within yourself to become your best and truest self, change your future and find lasting happiness.

item.title: Never Split the Difference
item.description: A well-written book guiding beginners through the complexities of negotiation. Author Chris Voss has years of experience, making him a true expert in the art of negotiation.

item.title: Atomic Habits
item.description: A supremely practical and useful book. James Clear distils the most fundamental information about habit formation, so you can accomplish more by focusing on less.

item.title: Measure What Matters
item.description: Legendary venture capitalist John Doerr reveals how the goal-setting system of Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) has helped tech giants from Intel to Google achieve explosive growth—and how it can help any organization thrive.

item.title: No Rules Rules
item.description: Netflix cofounder Reed Hastings reveals for the first time the unorthodox culture behind one of the world’s most innovative, imaginative, and successful companies.

item.title: The Sprint
item.description: Sprint offers a transformative formula for testing ideas that works whether you are at a startup or a large organization.

item.title: The Rollout
item.description: A Novel about Leadership and Building a Lean-Agile Enterprise with SAFe

item.title: Getting Things Done
item.description: Since it was first published almost fifteen years ago, David Allen’s Getting Things Done has become one of the most influential business books of its era, and the ultimate book on personal organization.

item.title: Inspired
item.description: How do todays most successful tech companies—Amazon, Google, Facebook, Netflix, Tesla—define, design and develop the products that have earned the love of literally billions of people around the world?

item.title: Team Topologies
item.description: Effective software teams are essential for any organization to deliver value continuously and sustainably. But how do you build the best team organization for your specific goals, culture, and needs?

item.title: First, Break All the Rules,
item.description: The greatest managers in the world seem to have little in common. Great managers share one common trait: They do not hesitate to break virtually every rule held sacred by conventional wisdom.

item.title: What got you here wont get you there
item.description: What’s holding you back? Your hard work is paying off. You are doing well in your field. But there is something standing between you and the next level of achievement.

item.title: Master Your Emotions & Motivation
item.description: Want to overcome negative feelings? Feel like you aren’t good enough? Need help dealing with stress? The solution to deal with negative emotions is to understand how your emotions work and apply specific techniques to ensure you manage them as effectively as possible.

item.title: The Phoenix Project
item.description: A Novel about IT and DevOps — Understand the organization’s challenges so clearly that transformation becomes inevitable. This book has become the unexpected playbook for digital transformation.

item.title: Hit Refresh
item.description: At the core, Hit Refresh is about us humans and the unique quality we call empathy, which will become ever more valuable in a world where the torrent of technology will disrupt the status quo like never before.

item.title: Elon Musk: Tesla, SpaceX, and the Quest for a Fantastic Future
item.description: Elon Musk spotlights the technology and vision of Elon Musk, the renowned entrepreneur and innovator behind SpaceX, Tesla, and SolarCity, who sold one of his Internet companies, PayPal, for $1.5 billion.

item.title: The Courage to Be Disliked
item.description: The Courage to Be Disliked unfolds as a dialogue between a philosopher and a young man, who, over the course of five enriching conversations, realizes that each of us is in control of our life’s direction, independent of past burdens and expectations of others.

item.title: The Courage to Be Happy
item.description: What if one simple choice could unlock your destiny?

item.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
item.description: The book delineates rational and non-rational motivations or triggers associated with each type of thinking process, and how they complement each other, starting with Kahnemans own research on loss aversion.
